content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t minus 3"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t minus 4"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math> for <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. On which of the following intervals will the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinate be positive?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less than 3"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></math> only
<math alttext="0 less or equal than t less than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
